Description: Rim, body and handle sherd (mended from six fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) pottery lotus bowl; brown clay with white inclusions; interior: wall glazed with three painted bands of white-red-white stripes; tondo reserved with three lines preserved; exterior: band at top of lip; pendent lotus flower between two large dots and two sets of verticals; broad band below; inscription cut in decorated zone.
Dimensions: Width: 14.30 centimetres ((including the preserved part of the handle))
Curator's comments: Joins 1886,0401.802; see D. M. Bailey 1970: 'Some Fresh Naukratis Joins', BSA, 65, p. 3, no. 1, pl. 1.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, nos 293, 298)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 256, no. 3) ((bowls with pendent lotus))
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 668, no. 254)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.587)
